entities.name: professor marchbanks
entities.description: Professor Marchbanks is mentioned as the one who said 'Turn over your papers' and flicked over the giant hourglass. He is in charge of the examination.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a student taking the examination. He is having difficulty remembering names and dates.

entities.name: wasp
entities.description: A wasp is buzzing against one of the high windows, distracting Harry.

entities.name: goblin riots
entities.description: Goblin riots are mentioned as a topic in question four.

entities.name: wand legislation
entities.description: Wand legislation is mentioned as a possible contributor to the control of goblin riots.

entities.name: statute of secrecy
entities.description: The Statute of Secrecy is mentioned as being breached in 1749.

entities.name: vampires
entities.description: Vampires are mentioned as possibly coming into the story.

relationships.description: Harry is distracted by the wasp buzzing against one of the high windows.
Wand legislation may have contributed to the control of goblin riots.
The Statute of Secrecy was breached in 1749.
Harry has a nagging suspicion that vampires may have come into the story.
